title: Victor Agbo
text:
Victor Ikechukwu Agbo (born December 19, 1980) is a Nigerian retired <a href="Association%20football">football</a>er.
Career.
He spent most of his career in Serbia where he represented several top and lower league clubs, namely <a href="FK%20BSK%20Bor%C4%8Da">FK BSK Borča</a>, <a href="FK%20%C5%BDitora%C4%91a">FK Žitorađa</a>, <a href="FK%20Grafi%C4%8Dar%20Beograd">FK Grafičar Beograd</a>, <a href="FK%20Novi%20Pazar">FK Novi Pazar</a>, <a href="FK%20Mladost%20Apatin">FK Mladost Apatin</a>, <a href="FK%20Sloga%20Kraljevo">FK Sloga Kraljevo</a>, <a href="FK%20%C5%A0umadija%20Aran%C4%91elovac">FK Šumadija Aranđelovac</a> and <a href="FK%20Rudar%20Kostolac">FK Rudar Kostolac</a>. Beside these, he also played with Bosnian Serb club <a href="FK%20Rudar%20Ugljevik">FK Rudar Ugljevik</a> in the <a href="Premier%20League%20of%20Bosnia%20and%20Herzegovina">Premier League of Bosnia and Herzegovina</a> and with <a href="OFK%20Grbalj">OFK Grbalj</a> in the <a href="Montenegrin%20First%20League">Montenegrin First League</a>. He last played with <a href="FK%20Hajduk%20Veljko">FK Hajduk Veljko</a> in the <a href="Serbian%20League%20East">Serbian League East</a>.
In September 2018 he became the director of the newly inaugurated Football Academy Benson in <a href="Jagodina">Jagodina</a>.
In some sources his name is spelled as "Victor Agboh", and in Serbia often "Viktor Agbo".
